intro: Erigeron diplostephioides, commonly known as the blueweed or blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as swamps, marshes, and stream banks. It produces showy blue to purple flower heads that bloom in late summer to early fall. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
